39  /**
40  * \brief Enumeration for differing types of Gauss quadrature.
41  * The gauss_quad_type is used to determine the boundary condition
42  * modifications applied to orthogonal polynomials for quadrature
43  * rules.
44  */
45  enum gauss_quad_type
46  {
47  Gauss, ///< Gauss quadrature
48  Gauss_Lobatto, ///< Gauss-Lobatto quadrature
49  Gauss_Radau_lower, ///< Gauss-Radau quadrature including the node -1
50  Gauss_Radau_upper ///< Gauss-Radau quadrature including the node +1
51  };
52 
53  /**
54  * A type describing the state of a Hermite polynomial.
55  */
56  template<typename Tp>
57  struct hermite_t
58  {
59  unsigned int n;
60  Tp x;
61  Tp H_n;
62  Tp H_nm1;
63  Tp H_nm2;
64 
65  constexpr Tp
66  deriv() const noexcept
67  { return Tp(2 * n) * H_nm1; }
68 
69  constexpr Tp
70  deriv2() const noexcept
71  { return Tp(4 * n * (n - 1)) * H_nm2; }
72  };
73 
74  /**
75  * A type describing the state of a probabilists Hermite polynomial.
76  */
77  template<typename Tp>
78  struct hermite_he_t
79  {
80  unsigned int n;
81  Tp x;
82  Tp He_n;
83  Tp He_nm1;
84  Tp He_nm2;
85 
86  constexpr Tp
87  deriv() const noexcept
88  { return Tp(n) * He_nm1; }
89 
90  constexpr Tp
91  deriv2() const noexcept
92  { return Tp(n * (n - 1)) * He_nm2; }
93  };
94 
95  /**
96  * A type describing the state of a Legendre polynomial.
97  *
98  * The method lobatto() will return the Lobatto polynomial:
99  * @f[
100  * Lo_l(x) = (1 - x^2)P'_l(x) = l \left[ P_{l - 1}(x) - x P_l(x) \right]
101  * @f]
102  */
103  template<typename Tp>
104  struct legendre_p_t
105  {
106  unsigned int l;
107  Tp x;
108  Tp P_l; /// P_l(x)
109  Tp P_lm1; /// P_{l-1}(x)
110  Tp P_lm2; /// P_{l-2}(x)
111 
112  // Return the Lobatto polynomial.
113  constexpr Tp
114  lobatto() const noexcept
115  { return l * (P_l - x * P_lm1); }
116 
117  constexpr Tp
118  deriv() const noexcept
119  {
120  if (std::abs(x) == Tp{1})
121  {
122  const auto sgn = x == Tp{+1}
123  ? Tp{+1}
124  : (l % 2 == 0 ? Tp{-1} : Tp{+1});
125  return sgn * Tp(l) * Tp(l + 1) / Tp{2};
126  }
127  else
128  return l * (x * P_l - P_lm1)
129  / ((Tp{1} - x) * (Tp{1} + x));
130  }
131  };
132 
133  /**
134  * A type describing the state of an associated Legendre function.
135  */
136  template<typename Tp>
137  struct assoc_legendre_p_t
138  {
139  unsigned int l;
140  unsigned int m;
141  Tp x;
142  Tp P_lm; /// P_l^{(m)}(x)
143  Tp P_lm1m; /// P_{l-1}^{(m)}(x)
144  Tp P_lm2m; /// P_{l-2}^{(m)}(x)
145  Tp phase = 1; // -1 For Condon-Shortley.
146 
147  constexpr Tp
148  deriv() const noexcept
149  {
150  if (std::abs(x) == Tp{1})
151  {
152  const auto sgn = x == Tp{+1}
153  ? Tp{+1}
154  : (l % 2 == 0 ? Tp{-1} : Tp{+1});
155  if (m == 0)
156  return sgn * Tp(l) * Tp(l + 1) / Tp{2};
157  else if (m == 1)
158  {
159  const auto sgn = x == Tp{+1}
160  ? Tp{+1}
161  : (l % 2 == 0 ? Tp{+1} : Tp{-1});
162  return -phase * sgn * std::numeric_limits<Tp>::infinity();
163  }
164  else if (m == 2)
165  return -sgn * Tp(l + 2) * Tp(l + 1) / Tp{2}
166  * Tp(l) * Tp(int(l) - 1) / Tp{2};
167  else
168  return Tp{0};
169  }
170  else
171  return -phase * ((l + m) * P_lm1m - l * x * P_lm)
172  / ((Tp{1} - x) * (Tp{1} + x));
173  }
174  };
175 
176  /**
177  * A type describing the state of a Legendre function of the second kind.
178  */
179  template<typename Tp>
180  struct legendre_q_t
181  {
182  unsigned int l;
183  Tp x;
184  Tp Q_l; /// Q_l(x)
185  Tp Q_lm1; /// Q_{l-1}(x)
186  Tp Q_lm2; /// Q_{l-2}(x)
187 
188  constexpr Tp
189  deriv() const noexcept
190  {
191  if (std::abs(x) == Tp{1})
192  return Tp(l % 2 == 1 ? -1 : +1)
193  * std::numeric_limits<Tp>::infinity();
194  else
195  return Tp(l) * (x * Q_l - Q_lm1)
196  / ((Tp{1} - x) * (Tp{1} + x));
197  }
198  };
199 
200  /**
201  * A type describing the state of an associated Legendre function
202  * of the second kind.
203  */
204  template<typename Tp>
205  struct assoc_legendre_q_t
206  {
207  unsigned int l; /// degree
208  unsigned int m; /// order
209  Tp x; /// argument
210  Tp Q_lm; /// Q_l^{(m)}(x)
211  Tp Q_lmm1; /// Q_l^{(m-1)}(x)
212  Tp Q_lmm2; /// Q_l^{(m-2)}(x)
213  Tp phase = 1; // -1 For Condon-Shortley.
214 
215  constexpr Tp
216  deriv() const noexcept
217  {
218  if (std::abs(x) == 1)
219  return Tp(l % 2 == 1 ? -1 : +1)
220  * std::numeric_limits<Tp>::infinity();
221  else
222  {
223  const auto fact = (Tp{1} - x) * (Tp{1} + x);
224  const auto root = std::sqrt(Tp{1} - x)
225  * std::sqrt(Tp{1} + x);
226  return Tp(m) * x * Q_lm / fact
227  + Tp(l + m) * Tp(l - m + 1) * Q_lmm1 / root;
228  }
229  }
230  };
231 
232  /**
233  * A type describing the state of a Laguerre polynomial.
234  */
235  template<typename Tpa, typename Tp>
236  struct laguerre_t
237  {
238  unsigned int n;
239  Tpa alpha1;
240  Tp x;
241  Tp L_n;
242  Tp L_nm1;
243  Tp L_nm2;
244 
245  constexpr Tp
246  deriv() const noexcept
247  { return (Tp(n) * L_nm1 - Tp(n + alpha1) * L_nm2) / x; }
248  };
249 
250  /**
251  * A type describing the state of a Jacobi polynomial.
252  */
253  template<typename Tp>
254  struct jacobi_t
255  {
256  unsigned int n;
257  Tp alpha1;
258  Tp beta1;
259  Tp x;
260  Tp P_n;
261  Tp P_nm1;
262  Tp P_nm2;
263 
264  constexpr Tp
265  deriv() const noexcept
266  {
267  auto apbp2k = alpha1 + beta1 + Tp(2 * n);
268  return (n * (alpha1 - beta1 - apbp2k * x) * P_nm1
269  + Tp{2} * (n + alpha1) * (n + beta1) * P_nm2)
270  / (apbp2k * (Tp{1} - x * x));
271  }
272  };
273 
274  /**
275  * A type describing the state of a Gegenbauer polynomial.
276  */
277  template<typename Tp>
278  struct gegenbauer_t
279  {
280  unsigned int n;
281  Tp lambda;
282  Tp x;
283  Tp C_n;
284  Tp C_nm1;
285  Tp C_nm2;
286 
287  constexpr Tp
288  deriv() const noexcept
289  {
290  auto apbp2k = Tp{2} * lambda + Tp(2 * n);
291  return (n * (-apbp2k * x) * C_nm1
292  + Tp{2} * (n + lambda) * (n + lambda) * C_nm2)
293  / (apbp2k * (Tp{1} - x * x));
294  }
295  };
296 
297  /**
298  * A type describing the state of a Chebyshev polynomial of the first kind.
299  */
300  template<typename Tp>
301  struct chebyshev_t_t
302  {
303  unsigned int n;
304  Tp x;
305  Tp T_n;
306  Tp T_nm1;
307  Tp T_nm2;
308 
309  constexpr Tp
310  deriv() const noexcept
311  { return Tp(n) * (T_nm1 - x * T_n) / (Tp{1} - x * x); }
312 
313  constexpr Tp
314  deriv2() const noexcept
315  {
316  const auto xx = x * x;
317  const auto num = Tp{1} - xx;
318  return Tp(n)
319  * (x * T_nm1 + (Tp(n - 1) * xx - Tp(n)) * T_n)
320  / num / num;
321  }
322  };
323 
324  /**
325  * A type describing the state of a Chebyshev polynomial of the second kind.
326  */
327  template<typename Tp>
328  struct chebyshev_u_t
329  {
330  unsigned int n;
331  Tp x;
332  Tp U_n;
333  Tp U_nm1;
334  Tp U_nm2;
335 
336  constexpr Tp
337  deriv() const noexcept
338  {
339  return (Tp(n + 1) * U_nm1 - Tp(n) * x * U_n)
340  / (Tp{1} - x * x);
341  }
342  };
343 
344  /**
345  * A type describing the state of a Chebyshev polynomial of the third kind.
346  */
347  template<typename Tp>
348  struct chebyshev_v_t
349  {
350  unsigned int n;
351  Tp x;
352  Tp V_n;
353  Tp V_nm1;
354  Tp V_nm2;
355 
356  constexpr Tp
357  deriv() const noexcept
358  {
359  auto apbp2k = Tp(2 * n);
360  return (n * (Tp{1} - apbp2k * x) * V_nm1
361  + Tp(2 * (n + 0.5L) * (n + -0.5L)) * V_nm2)
362  / (apbp2k * (Tp{1} - x * x));
363  }
364  };
365 
366  /**
367  * A type describing the state of a Chebyshev polynomial of the fourth kind.
368  */
369  template<typename Tp>
370  struct chebyshev_w_t
371  {
372  unsigned int n;
373  Tp x;
374  Tp W_n;
375  Tp W_nm1;
376  Tp W_nm2;
377 
378  constexpr Tp
379  deriv() const noexcept
380  {
381  auto apbp2k = Tp(2 * n);
382  return (n * (Tp{-1} - apbp2k * x) * W_nm1
383  + Tp(2 * (n - 0.5L) * (n + 0.5L)) * W_nm2)
384  / (apbp2k * (Tp{1} - x * x));
385  }
386  };
387 
388  template<typename Tx, typename Tp>
389  struct airy_t
390  {
391  /// The argument of the Airy fuctions.
392  Tx x_arg;
393 
394  /// The value of the Airy function Ai.
395  Tp Ai_value;
396 
397  /// The derivative of the Airy function Ai.
398  Tp Ai_deriv;
399 
400  /// The value of the Airy function Bi.
401  Tp Bi_value;
402 
403  /// The derivative of the Airy function Bi.
404  Tp Bi_deriv;
405 
406  /// Return the Wronskian of this Airy function state.
407  constexpr Tp
408  Wronskian() const noexcept
409  { return Ai_value * Bi_deriv - Bi_value * Ai_deriv; }
410  };
411 
412  /**
413  * Tp pretty much has to be complex.
414  */
415  template<typename Tx, typename Tp>
416  struct fock_airy_t
417  {
418  /// The argument of the Fock-type Airy fuctions.
419  Tx x_arg;
420 
421  /// The value of the Fock-type Airy function w1.
422  Tp w1_value;
423 
424  /// The derivative of the Fock-type Airy function w1.
425  Tp w1_deriv;
426 
427  /// The value of the Fock-type Airy function w2.
428  Tp w2_value;
429 
430  /// The derivative of the Fock-type Airy function w2.
431  Tp w2_deriv;
432 
433  /// Return the Wronskian of this Fock-type Airy function state.
434  constexpr Tp
435  Wronskian() const noexcept
436  { return w1_value * w2_deriv - w2_value * w1_deriv; }
437  };

439  /**
440  * This struct captures the state of the cylindrical Bessel functions
441  * at a given order and argument.
442  */
443  template<typename Tnu, typename Tx, typename Tp>
444  struct cyl_bessel_t
445  {
446  /// The real order of the cylindrical Bessel functions.
447  Tnu nu_arg;
448 
449  /// The argument of the cylindrical Bessel functions.
450  Tx x_arg;
451 
452  /// The value of the Bessel function of the first kind.
453  Tp J_value;
454 
455  /// The derivative of the Bessel function of the first kind.
456  Tp J_deriv;
457 
458  /// The value of the Bessel function of the second kind.
459  Tp N_value;
460 
461  /// The derivative of the Bessel function of the second kind.
462  Tp N_deriv;
463 
464  /// Return the Wronskian of this cylindrical Bessel function state.
465  constexpr Tp
466  Wronskian() const noexcept
467  { return J_value * N_deriv - N_value * J_deriv; }
468  };
469 
470  /**
471  * This struct captures the state of the Coulomb functions
472  * at a given order and argument.
473  */
474  template<typename Teta, typename Trho, typename Tp>
475  struct coulomb_t
476  {
477  /// The nonnegative order of the Coulomb functions.
478  unsigned int l;
479 
480  /// The real parameter of the Coulomb functions.
481  Teta eta_arg;
482 
483  /// The argument of the Coulomb functions.
484  Trho rho_arg;
485 
486  /// The value of the regular Coulomb function.
487  Tp F_value;
488 
489  /// The derivative of the regular Coulomb function.
490  Tp F_deriv;
491 
492  /// The value of the irregular Coulomb function.
493  Tp G_value;
494 
495  /// The derivative of the irregular Coulomb function.
496  Tp G_deriv;
497 
498  /// Return the Wronskian of this Coulomb function state.
499  constexpr Tp
500  Wronskian() const noexcept
501  { return F_value * G_deriv - G_value * F_deriv; }
502  };
503 
504  /**
505  * This struct captures the state of the modified cylindrical Bessel functions
506  * at a given order and argument.
507  */
508  template<typename Tnu, typename Tx, typename Tp>
509  struct cyl_mod_bessel_t
510  {
511  /// The real order of the modified cylindrical Bessel functions.
512  Tnu nu_arg;
513 
514  /// The argument of the modified cylindrical Bessel functions.
515  Tx x_arg;
516 
517  /// The value of the modified cylindrical Bessel function
518  /// of the first kind.
519  Tp I_value;
520 
521  /// The derivative of the modified cylindrical Bessel function
522  /// of the first kind.
523  Tp I_deriv;
524 
525  /// The value of the modified cylindrical Bessel function
526  /// of the second kind.
527  Tp K_value;
528 
529  /// The derivative of the modified cylindrical Bessel function
530  /// of the second kind.
531  Tp K_deriv;
532 
533  /// Return the Wronskian of this modified cylindrical Bessel function
534  /// state.
535  constexpr Tp
536  Wronskian() const noexcept
537  { return I_value * K_deriv - K_value * I_deriv; }
538  };
539 
540  /**
541  * Tp pretty much has to be complex.
542  */
543  template<typename Tnu, typename Tx, typename Tp>
544  struct cyl_hankel_t
545  {
546  /// The real order of the cylindrical Hankel functions.
547  Tnu nu_arg;
548 
549  /// The argument of the modified Hankel functions.
550  Tx x_arg;
551 
552  /// The value of the cylindrical Hankel function of the first kind.
553  Tp H1_value;
554 
555  /// The derivative of the cylindrical Hankel function of the first kind.
556  Tp H1_deriv;
557 
558  /// The value of the cylindrical Hankel function of the second kind.
559  Tp H2_value;
560 
561  /// The derivative of the cylindrical Hankel function of the second kind.
562  Tp H2_deriv;
563 
564  /// Return the Wronskian of this cylindrical Hankel function state.
565  constexpr Tp
566  Wronskian() const noexcept
567  { return H1_value * H2_deriv - H2_value * H1_deriv; }
568  };

570  template<typename Tn, typename Tx, typename Tp>
571  struct sph_bessel_t
572  {
573  /// The integral order of the spherical Bessel functions.
574  Tn n_arg;
575 
576  /// The argument of the spherical Bessel functions.
577  Tx x_arg;
578 
579  /// The value of the spherical Bessel function of the first kind.
580  Tp j_value;
581 
582  /// The derivative of the spherical Bessel function of the first kind.
583  Tp j_deriv;
584 
585  /// The value of the spherical Bessel function of the second kind.
586  Tp n_value;
587 
588  /// The derivative of the spherical Bessel function of the second kind.
589  Tp n_deriv;
590 
591  /// Return the Wronskian of this spherical Bessel function state.
592  constexpr Tp
593  Wronskian() const noexcept
594  { return j_value * n_deriv - n_value * j_deriv; }
595  };

598  struct sph_mod_bessel_t
599  {
600  /// The integral order of the modified spherical Bessel functions.
601  Tn n_arg;

603  /// The argument of the modified spherical Bessel functions.

605 
606  /// The value of the modified spherical Bessel function
607  /// of the first kind.

609 
610  /// The derivative of the modified spherical Bessel function
611  /// of the first kind.
612  Tp i_deriv;
613 
614  /// The value of the modified spherical Bessel function
615  /// of the second kind.

617 
618  /// The derivative of the modified spherical Bessel function
619  /// of the second kind.
620  Tp k_deriv;
621 
622  /// Return the Wronskian of this modified cylindrical Bessel function
623  /// state.
624  constexpr Tp
625  Wronskian() const noexcept
626  { return i_value * k_deriv - k_value * i_deriv; }
627  };

669  /**
670  * The log of the absolute value of the gamma function
671  * The sign of the exponentiated log(gamma) is stored in sign.
672  */
673  template<typename Tp>
674  struct lgamma_t
675  {
676  /// The value log gamma function.
677  Tp lgamma_value;
678 
679  /// The sign of the exponent of the log gamma value.
680  int lgamma_sign;
681  };
682 
683  /**
684  * The sign of the exponentiated log(gamma) is appied to the tgamma value.
685  */
686  template<typename Tp>
687  struct gamma_inc_t
688  {
689  /// The value of the total gamma function.
690  Tp tgamma_value;
691  /// The value of the log of the incomplete gamma function
692  Tp lgamma_value;
693  };

695  /**
696  * @brief A structure for the gamma functions required by the Temme series
697  * expansions of @f$ N_\nu(x) @f$ and @f$ K_\nu(x) @f$.
698  * @f[
699  * \Gamma_1 = \frac{1}{2\mu}
700  * \left[\frac{1}{\Gamma(1 - \mu)} - \frac{1}{\Gamma(1 + \mu)}\right]
701  * @f]
702  * and
703  * @f[
704  * \Gamma_2 = \frac{1}{2}
705  * \left[\frac{1}{\Gamma(1 - \mu)} + \frac{1}{\Gamma(1 + \mu)}\right]
706  * @f]
707  * where @f$ -1/2 <= \mu <= 1/2 @f$ is @f$ \mu = \nu - N @f$ and @f$ N @f$.
708  * is the nearest integer to @f$ \nu @f$.
709  * The values of @f$ \Gamma(1 + \mu) @f$ and @f$ \Gamma(1 - \mu) @f$
710  * are returned as well.
711  *
712  * The accuracy requirements on this are high for @f$ |\mu| < 0 @f$.
713  */
714  template<typename Tp>
715  struct gamma_temme_t
716  {
717  /// The input parameter of the gamma functions
718  Tp mu_arg;
719 
720  /// The output function @f$ 1/\Gamma(1 + \mu) @f$
721  Tp gamma_plus_value;
722 
723  /// The output function @f$ 1/\Gamma(1 - \mu) @f$
724  Tp gamma_minus_value;
725 
726  /// The output function @f$ \Gamma_1(\mu) @f$
727  Tp gamma_1_value;
728 
729  /// The output function @f$ \Gamma_2(\mu) @f$
730  Tp gamma_2_value;
731  };
732 
733  /**
734  * @brief A structure for Stirling numbers of the first kind.
735  */
736  template<typename Tp>
737  struct stirling_1_t
738  {
739  using iterator = typename std::vector<Tp>::iterator;
740  using const_iterator = typename std::vector<Tp>::const_iterator;
741 
742  std::vector<Tp> sigma;
743 
744  unsigned int
745  degree() const noexcept
746  { return sigma.size() - 1; }
747 
748  Tp
749  operator[](unsigned int k) const noexcept
750  { return k < sigma.size() ? sigma[k] : Tp{0}; }
751 
752  template<typename Up>
753  auto
754  operator()(Up x) const noexcept
755  {
756  const auto n = sigma.size() - 1;
757  auto poly = sigma[n];
758  for (unsigned int i = 1; i < n; ++i)
759  poly = sigma[n - i] + x * poly;
760  }
761 
762  iterator
763  begin() noexcept
764  { return sigma.begin(); }
765 
766  iterator
767  end() noexcept
768  { return sigma.end(); }
769 
770  const_iterator
771  begin() const noexcept
772  { return this->sigma.begin(); }
773 
774  const_iterator
775  end() const noexcept
776  { return this->sigma.end(); }
777  };
778 
779  /**
780  * @brief A structure for Stirling numbers of the first kind.
781  */
782  template<typename Tp>
783  struct stirling_2_t
784  {
785  using iterator = typename std::vector<Tp>::iterator;
786  using const_iterator = typename std::vector<Tp>::const_iterator;
787 
788  std::vector<Tp> S;
789 
790  unsigned int
791  degree() const noexcept
792  { return S.size() - 1; }
793 
794  Tp
795  operator[](unsigned int k) const noexcept
796  { return k < S.size() ? S[k] : Tp{0}; }
797 
798  /// Return the Bell polynomial.
799  template<typename Up>
800  auto
801  operator()(Up x) const noexcept
802  {
803  const auto n = S.size() - 1;
804  auto poly = S[n];
805  for (unsigned int i = 1; i < n; ++i)
806  poly = S[n - i] + x * poly;
807  }
808 
809  iterator
810  begin() noexcept
811  { return S.begin(); }
812 
813  iterator
814  end() noexcept
815  { return S.end(); }
816 
817  const_iterator
818  begin() const noexcept
819  { return this->S.begin(); }
820 
821  const_iterator
822  end() const noexcept
823  { return this->S.end(); }
824  };
825 
826 } // namespace emsr
827 
828 #endif // SPECFUN_STATE_H
